title: Ramos Prats Lab 2
text:
Welcome to the Ramos Prats Lab. Our research focuses on understanding the neural mechanisms underlying anxiety, stress, and adaptive behavior.

title: Publications

title: Publications
text:
Publications by Year

2024
Durán-Silva, N., Carrillo, J., Plaza, L., Ricardo, S., Massuci, F.A., Veiga, S., Ramos-Prats, A.. (2024). BATRACIO: BAsic, TRAnslational, Clinical, Research Phase Identification in BiOmedical Publications. IEEE Access, vol. 12, pp. 146476-146493, 2024, doi: 10.1109/ACCESS.2024.3463717.
Ramos-Prats, A., Matulewicz, P., Edenhofer, M. L., Wang, K. Y., Yeh, C. W., Fajardo-Serrano, A., Kress, M., Kummer, K., Lien, C. C., & Ferraguti, F. (2024). Loss of mGlu5 receptors in somatostatin-expressing interneurons alters negative emotional states. Mol Psychiatry 29, 2774–2786 (2024). [DOI] https://doi.org/10.1038/s41380-024-02541-5


2023
Sadeghi, M., Ramos-Prats, A., Neto, P., Castaldi, F., Crowley, D., Matulewicz, P., Paradiso, E., Freysinger, W., Ferraguti, F., & Goebel, G. (2023). Localization and Registration of 2D Histological Mouse Brain Images in 3D Atlas Space. Neuroinformatics, 21(3), 615-630. DOI
Rahimi, S., Salami, P., Matulewicz, P., Schmuck, A., Bukovac, A., Ramos-Prats, A., Tasan, R. O., & Drexel, M. (2023). The role of subicular VIP-expressing interneurons on seizure dynamics in the intrahippocampal kainic acid model of temporal lobe epilepsy. Experimental Neurology, 370, 114580. DOI


2022
Ramos-Prats, A., Paradiso, E., Castaldi, F., Sadeghi, M., Mir, M. Y., Hörtnagl, H., Göbel, G., & Ferraguti, F. (2022). VIP-expressing interneurons in the anterior insular cortex contribute to sensory processing to regulate adaptive behavior. Cell Reports, 39(9), 110893. DOI
Matulewicz, P., Ramos-Prats, A., Gómez-Santacana, X., Llebaria, A., & Ferraguti, F. (2022). Control of Theta Oscillatory Activity Underlying Fear Expression by mGlu5 Receptors. Cells, 11(22). DOI


2021
Zangrandi, L., Schmuckermair, C., Ghareh, H., Castaldi, F., Heilbronn, R., Zernig, G., Ferraguti, F., & Ramos-Prats, A. (2021). Loss of mGluR5 in D1 Receptor-Expressing Neurons Improves Stress Coping. International Journal of Molecular Sciences, 22(15). DOI


2020
Alonso, L., Peeva, P., Ramos-Prats, A., Alenina, N., Winter, Y., & Rivalan, M. (2020). Inter-individual and inter-strain differences in cognitive and social abilities of Dark Agouti and Wistar Han rats. Behavioural Brain Research, 377, 112188. DOI


2019
Ramos-Prats, A., Kölldorfer, J., Paolo, E., Zeidler, M., Schmid, G., & Ferraguti, F. (2019). An Appraisal of the Influence of the Metabotropic Glutamate 5 (mGlu5) Receptor on Sociability and Anxiety. Frontiers in Molecular Neuroscience, 12, 30. DOI
Sanchís-Ollé, M., Fuentes, S., Úbeda-Contreras, J., Lalanza, J. F., Ramos-Prats, A., Armario, A., & Nadal, R. (2019). Controllability affects endocrine response of adolescent male rats to stress as well as impulsivity and behavioral flexibility during adulthood. Scientific Reports, 9(1), 3180. DOI

title: Publications
text:
Publication Metrics

Publications: 9 peer-reviewed articles
First author: 3 publications
Fields: Neuroscience, Molecular Biology, Behavioral Neuroscience
Research focus: Neural mechanisms of social behavior, anxiety, and stress processing; role of metabotropic glutamate receptors; interneuron function in brain circuits
Total Citations: ~120 (as of May 2025)
h-index: 6
i10-index: 4
